intro: Rauvolfia praecox, commonly known as the early morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, red berries that contain seeds. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit. Rauvolfia praecox is also known for its medicinal properties, though its use in traditional medicine varies by region.
